title: Is there any way to send and receive data without internet? - Quora

response.answer_text: It’s called the US Postal system. It is a legally recognized, very inexpensive way to send and receive data. The postal carrier will come to your door! and bring you mail and pick up mail to send out. Your nearby postal office not only handles regular mail and packages but can also handle money orders - a quick inexpensive way to send money securely all over the world! Imagine!

You can’t send data to the GPS satellites but there are other satellites that can receive data you send. These satellites listen on about 406MHz for data from a beacon.  I don’t believe it is possible for a phone to send these messages. Even if a phone could act in place of a beacon if would not make sense as the beacon transmits a unique id number that is matched to your information such as address and phone number by the rescue teams. This info is provided when you buy the beacon and would not be available if your phone did it.
